newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Jackson's show moves to Kuala Lumpur - organisers.
newsitem.headline: Jackson's show moves to Kuala Lumpur - organisers.

text.p: A proposed concert in Malaysia by pop star Michael Jackson has moved to the capital after one of the nation's 13 states banned the show, the concert's organisers said on Thursday.
Officials in central Selangor state last week banned Jackson from performing there on October 27, saying the singer and his show would have undesirable effects on Malaysia's youth.
But a Malaysian cabinet minister said on Wednesday the federal government in Kuala Lumpur had no objections to the concert.
"We are grateful that the cabinet has consented to us staging this...concert in Kuala Lumpur," Syed Yusof Nasir, a spokesman for organisers Jojo Entertainment, said in a statement.
Syed Yusof said the concert would probably be held at Kuala Lumpur's Stadium Merdeka, the country's most popular football stadium.
Jackson's stop in Kuala Lumpur is part of a world tour to promote his album, HIStory.
